page.title: 06COAL INDUSTRY
page.content: COAL MINING IS THE MAIN INDUSTRY OF THE AREA AND IN OUR SCHOOL OF 126 FAMILIES 56 HAVE ONE OR MORE WORKERS IN THE MINES. ONLY A FEW MONTHS AGO THE MINERS RETURNED TO WORK AFTER THE LONGEST STRIKE EVER WITHOUT ACHIEVING ANYTHING AND SO WE ASKED OUR FATHERS AND BROTHERS WHO ARE MINERS WHAT THEIR FEELINGS WERE. THEY SAID THAT SOON THERE WILL BE NO MINES AROUND BARNSLEY. THE NATIONAL COAL BOARD WAS OUT TO CLOSE THEM DOWN. THEY SAID THAT ALL DOMESTIC HEAT WOULD THEN BE PROVIDED BY GAS AND OIL. NONE OF THEM THOUGHT THEY WERE BEING PAID ENOUGH FOR WHAT THEY DID, AND ALTHOUGH IT IS A RISKY JOB THEY TRIED TO FORGET THE RISKS. IF THEY WERE HONEST THOUGH, THE RISKS WERE ALWAYS AT THE BACK OF THEIR MINDS.
